questions.text: What is the primary standard governing medical device risk management?

options.explanation: SOP-003 defines the risk management process per ISO 14971:2019.
ISO 13485 is the quality management system standard.
IEC 62304 governs software lifecycle, not risk management specifically.
Part 820 is the FDA QSR; ISO 14971 is the risk management standard.
Risk is calculated as severity multiplied by probability.
Risk is a product, not a sum, of severity and probability.
Detection is part of FMEA, but ISO 14971 risk uses severity x probability.
Risk is severity multiplied by probability, not divided.

questions.text: Which categories of hazards are tracked in the risk document structure? (Select all that apply)

options.explanation: Software hazards are tracked in risk/software/.
Usability hazards are tracked in risk/usability/.
Security hazards are tracked in risk/security/.
Environmental hazards are not a defined category in this QMS.

questions.text: What should be done when residual risk remains unacceptable after applying controls?

options.explanation: Unacceptable residual risk requires documented risk-benefit analysis.
Per Section 6, if residual risk is still unacceptable, a risk-benefit analysis must be provided.
Feature removal may be an option but the SOP requires risk-benefit analysis first.
Internal risk-benefit analysis is required before any regulatory escalation.

questions.text: Risk control measures are documented using the heading format '### [SRS-XXX](path) - Control Name' in risk analysis documents.
questions.explanation: Per Section 5, controls are documented with this specific heading format linking to the requirement that mitigates the risk.
